As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences, but here are some tips for maintaining healthy skin during the winter:

1. Moisturize regularly: The cold winter air can be very drying on the skin. Use a high-quality moisturizer to keep your skin hydrated.

2. Use a humidifier: Dry indoor air can also cause your skin to become dry and itchy. Using a humidifier can help keep your skin moist.

3. Wear sunscreen: Even though it's winter, the sun's harmful UV rays can still damage your skin. Use a broad-spectrum sunscreen to protect your skin.

4. Drink plenty of water: Staying hydrated is important for healthy skin. Drink plenty of water to keep your skin hydrated from the inside out.

5. Avoid hot showers: Hot water can strip your skin of its natural oils, leaving it dry and itchy. Take lukewarm showers instead.

6. Eat a healthy diet: Eating a diet rich in antioxidants and healthy fats can help keep your skin healthy and glowing.

7. Be gentle with your skin: Avoid using harsh soaps or scrubs, which can irritate your skin. Use a gentle cleanser and pat your skin dry instead of rubbing it with a towel.

8. Get plenty of sleep: Getting enough sleep is important for your overall health, including your skin. Aim for 7-8 hours of sleep each night.
